snippet: A torrent of lawsuits could add significantly to billions of dollars of settlements in mortgage securities cases.
abstract: Largest banks in the nation are facing a fresh torrent of lawsuits asserting that they sold shoddy mortgage securities that imploded during the financial crisis; cases could add significantly to the tens of billions of dollars banks have already paid to settle other cases, and some fear costs could reach $300 billion if the institutions lose all of the litigation, lowering profits and slowing nation's economic recovery.
lead_paragraph: A torrent of lawsuits could add significantly to billions of dollars of settlements in mortgage securities cases.

headline.main: Mortgage Crisis Presents a New Reckoning to Banks
headline.print_headline: Mortgage Crisis Presents Banks A New Reckoning
